column4: anyone care to explain the difference's between ubuntu 10.10 and slackware and which better suites a person's everday needs?
Slackware does not have package dependency solving (out of the box)...Ubuntu does
Package Dependency mean that if Package A requires Package B and C to work, Ubuntu will install B and C while Slackware will make you manually install B and C
It's not hard to work with Slack style distros, but you have to do your homework first
